means: 自由（自己选择生活方式而不受政府及权威限制）
自由（不受关押或奴役的状态）

sentence.Network_en: A system like ours lacks adequate safeguards for civil liberties.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们这样的制度缺乏有效保护公民自由的条款。

sentence.Network_en: The hard - won liberties should never be bargained away lightly.
sentence.Network_cn: 好容易才获得自由,绝不能轻易放弃.

sentence.Network_en: He's been taking liberties with our female staff.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一直对于我们的女职员过于随便.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 所以柏克声称英国的种种自由权利(liberties)是有“族谱”的(pedigree)。(29页)典章制度的沿续性最根本地体现在继承(inheri－tage)这个概.
但是我们需要强调指出的是，尽管自由的用法多样且不尽相同，然自由只有一种。只有当自由缺失时，“自由权项”（liberties）才会凸显，因为“自由权项”乃是指某些群体及个人在其他人或群体多少不自由的时候仍可获致的具体的特权或豁.
Bill took liberties with Tom ' s bicycle ., 比尔任意使用汤姆的自行车.
The Swiss generally take civil liberties very seriously , whether animal , vegetable or human ., 瑞士一般非常注重对人民自由的尊重 , 无论是动物 , 蔬菜还是人.

list.abs: “自由钟”（Liberty Bell）是美国费城国家独立历史公园里的一件珍贵文物。在美国发行的铸币上，曾两次出现“自由钟”的图案，1948年 …
公民自由（Civil Liberties）往往指公民的政治自由。公民自由限制了政府的权力，防止政府滥用权力和干扰其公民的生活。
478 论自由（ON LIBERTY），By （英）J．S．密尔（John Stuart Mill）479 法官和他的刽子手，By （瑞士）弗·迪伦马特480 政府 …
自由岛（liberty island）(Liberty Island )，亦称自由女神岛，旧称白德路岛(Bedloe's Island, 1956年以前)。 美国纽约市一岛屿，在上纽约湾内，隔水与 …

entry.def: Liberty is the freedom to live your life in the way that you want, without interference from other people or the authorities.

example.ex: Wit Wolzek claimed the legislation could impinge on privacy, self determination and respect for religious liberty...
example.tran: 威特·沃尔泽克声称这项法律可能会对隐私权和自主权造成侵犯，并破坏对宗教自由的尊重。

example.ex: Such a system would be a fundamental blow to the rights and liberties of the English people.
example.tran: 这样一种制度将对英国人民的权利与自由造成根本性的打击。

entry.def: Liberty is the freedom to go wherever you want, which you lose when you are a prisoner.

example.ex: Why not say that three convictions before court for stealing cars means three months' loss of liberty...
example.tran: 为什么不说被判3项偷车罪名就意味着丧失3个月的人身自由呢？

example.ex: There is no formal confirmation so far that he is at liberty.
example.tran: 目前还没有正式确认他已经获得人身自由。

entry.def: If someone is at liberty to do something, they have been given permission to do it.

example.ex: The island's in the Pacific Ocean; I'm  not at liberty to say exactly where, because  we're still negotiating for its purchase.
example.tran: 这个岛在太平洋上；我无权说出它的具体位置，因为我们仍在洽谈购买事宜。

entry.def: If you say that you have taken the liberty of doing something, you are saying that you have done it without asking permission. People say this when they do not think that anyone will mind what they have done.

example.ex: I took the liberty of going into Assunta's wardrobe, as it was open; I was looking for a towel.
example.tran: 阿孙塔的衣橱敞着，我便擅自在里面翻了一下。我想找一条毛巾。

entry.tran: （对某人）过分亲昵，表现无礼；（对某事物）过于随便
entry.def: If you take liberties or take a liberty with someone or something, you act in a way that is too free and does not show enough respect.

example.ex: Try and retain the excitement of the event in your writing, without taking liberties with the truth...
example.tran: 请尽量在文字中再现活动的热烈气氛，但不要对事实添油加醋，任意窜改。

example.ex: She knew she was taking a big liberty in developing Mick's photos without his knowledge.
example.tran: 她知道没告诉米克就擅自冲洗他的照片是太过放肆了。

auth_sentence.content: Press freedom, like all liberties, is indivisible.
auth_sentence.res_content: Press freedom, like all liberties, is indivisible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Press freedom, like all liberties, is indivisible.

auth_sentence.content: They protested against...Papal inroads on the liberties of the Church.
auth_sentence.res_content: They protested against...Papal inroads on the liberties of the Church.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They protested against...Papal inroads on the liberties of the Church.

auth_sentence.content: So we can't take liberties and do it in English.
auth_sentence.res_content: So we can't take liberties and do it in English.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So we can't take liberties and do it in English.
